stream_context.summary: Kaze debugged and refined the Raphael-the-Raven boss fight that takes place on a small "moon" planet. Most of the stream involved fixing hitbox/scaling bugs, deciding how players collect the star and leave the arena, and polishing the introductory cut-scene with camera paths and gravity effects.

development_findings.summary: Raphael’s hurtbox stopped working because the model scale had been reduced to zero; restoring a reasonable scale fixed collisions.
development_findings.quote: The scale of Raphael Raven was too small. He was scaling down so far that his hitbox was 0.

development_findings.summary: Each hit now makes Raphael grow larger, move faster, and spawn shockwaves more quickly, but Kaze will also slow him down over time to guarantee eventual victory.
development_findings.quote: I'm thinking we make it slower the longer the fight goes. That way, everyone is guaranteed to beat it eventually.

development_findings.summary: Planned visual upgrades: background rotation around the planet, 360-spin reaction animation, color changes, camera shakes, and VFX/SFX once core logic is stable.
Initial plan to spawn a pipe for returning from the moon was abandoned due to complex quaternion-to-Euler rotation math; instead the raven egg now hatches directly into the star above the planet.
development_findings.quote: I think the pipe sucks programming-wise… I'm just gonna spawn the star on top of the moon.

development_findings.summary: Fixed star placement by transforming it into world space with the inverse planet quaternion, preventing it from sliding across the surface when Mario moves.
development_findings.quote: The star is now in world space. Perfect.

development_findings.summary: Cut-scene flow: Raven blocks the moon, eyes open, stomps platform, flips gravity, Mario follows parabolic path to moon; camera path being tweaked with custom easing functions instead of SmoothStep.
Hub world concept: a Mario Party-style Yoshi’s Island where coins can be spent to build bridges, grow trees, and unlock progression elements.
development_findings.quote: With the coins you can unlock progression in the overworld… pay someone to build a bridge or… buy a tree and then you can climb on that.

development_findings.summary: Kaze relies heavily on quaternion math for planet gravity, object attachment, and camera orientation, using decompilation knowledge of SM64.
development_findings.quote: If you watch my newest video and know a little about quaternions you can do this too.

development_findings.summary: Cheat key (L) instantly kills Raphael for rapid testing; crash earlier was traced to using an old pointer instead of obj pointer when spawning the star.

context_findings.summary: Kaze rates current mental pain as 8/10, mostly due to German bureaucracy issues.
context_findings.quote: I'm in mental pain because of bureaucracy.

context_findings.summary: He is frustrated by constant release-date harassment and plans to reply with lowercase 'xd' and let chat mock the requester.
context_findings.quote: The most messed-up part of being a famous ROM-hacker is when people harass me about the release date… I'm thinking every time someone does that, I will just respond with a lowercase xd.

context_findings.summary: Kaze plans to produce more explanatory YouTube videos (e.g., BLJ, paintings, MIPS clip) to generate income for his family now that he hired an editor.
context_findings.quote: I'm thinking I should make a lot more videos… make more money for my family.

context_findings.summary: Maintains strict no-alcohol rule, ties physical fitness to mental health, proud of his smooth skin; interacts playfully with chat on these topics.
context_findings.quote: You gotta take care of your body if you wanna take care of your mind.

biobak.summary: Suggested rotating background and color/blur effects during the fight; Kaze approved and will rely on Biobak’s art to enhance visual impact.
biobak.quote: Biobak, you can make this fight look so cool with the background. Imagine the whole background here just rotating around.

biobak.summary: Proposed concept where Raven blocks the moon entirely, leading to debate on compatibility with current pipe/star ideas.

zeina.summary: Created original meteor code and is currently producing all boss animations; Kaze awaiting her work (e.g., 360-spin hit reaction, death animations).
zeina.quote: Zeina is currently working on all the animations.

zeina.summary: Chat confusion about relationship status surfaced; Kaze clarified he is still with Zeina (implicitly confirming professional/personal overlap).
zeina.quote: Are you still with Zinnia? No? I've never known a Zinnia in my life. Do you mean Zayna?

key_stories.title: The Vanishing Hurtbox
key_stories.summary: Early in the session Kaze discovered Raphael could no longer be damaged. Investigation showed the boss had been uniformly scaled down during recent tweaks, shrinking the hitbox to zero. Restoring the correct scale immediately re-enabled collisions.
key_stories.challenge: Raphael Raven no longer registered hits.
key_stories.process: Printed Y-positions, inspected distance checks, realized model scale changes affected hitbox; increased scale and added dynamic scaling per hit.
key_stories.outcome: Boss is hittable again and now visually grows after each hit, improving both difficulty balance and readability.
key_stories.key_quote: The scale of Raphael Raven was too small… his hitbox was 0.

key_stories.title: Scrapping the Return Pipe
key_stories.summary: Kaze wanted a pipe to appear after beating Raphael so players could exit the moon, but aligning the pipe’s cylindrical orientation with the planet’s surface demanded messy quaternion-to-Euler conversions. After multiple failed tests, he opted for a simpler, more intuitive solution: hatch the star directly from the egg and let players collect it on the moon.
key_stories.challenge: Implement a correctly rotated pipe on a spherical surface.
key_stories.process: Spawned pipe object, debugged wrong model ID, struggled with rotation math, discussed alternatives with chat and Biobak.
key_stories.outcome: Pipe idea dropped; star now spawns in world space above player, code cleaned up; returns are no longer required.
key_stories.key_quote: I think the pipe sucks programming-wise… I'm just gonna spawn the star on top of the moon.
